tournament.name: MTG China Regional Championship - Open S9

decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the Omniscience combo by using cards like Marang River Regent, Roiling Dragonstorm, and Temporary Lockdown to gain card advantage and control the board. The deck utilizes spells like Ephara's Dispersal and Spell Pierce to protect its key pieces while also using cards like Stock Up and Meticulous Archive to draw into combo pieces. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a powerful combination of spells and creatures, ultimately leading to a game-winning play involving Omniscience.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures such as Drake Hatcher, Monastery Swiftspear, and Cori-Steel Cutter. The deck includes a variety of low-cost spells like Burst Lightning, Monstrous Rage, and Opt to deal damage and control the board. Card draw is important with cards like Sleight of Hand and Stock Up, while Stormchaser's Talent provides additional power to creatures. The mana base consists of a mix of Islands, Mountains, and dual lands for consistency in casting spells.

The main idea behind this Orzhov Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan through a combination of removal spells, discard effects, and powerful creatures. By using cards like Duress and Cut Down to strip the opponent's hand and removal spells like Go for the Throat to deal with threats, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's tempo. The deck also utilizes powerful creatures like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Archfiend of the Dross to apply pressure and close out the game. Overall, the key concept is to control the game and outvalue the opponent.

The key idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle using Low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter, backed up by spell cards like Burst Lightning and Stormchaser's Talent. The deck aims to quickly build up a board presence and constantly apply pressure to the opponent, making it difficult for them to mount a defense. By combining creature aggression with direct damage spells, this deck seeks to win the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The deck focuses on aggressive plays with a mix of creatures and spells to control the battlefield and pressure the opponent. It includes a variety of low cost creatures with abilities that disrupt the opponent's strategy, such as temporary lockdown and nowhere to run. The deck also utilizes cards like nurturing pixie and sunpearl kirin to maintain board presence and apply pressure. The mana base allows for consistent access to the deck's colors, ensuring smooth gameplay and efficient deployment of threats.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. Utilizing creatures with abilities like trample and haste, along with direct damage spells, it aims to deal damage early and often. The deck also includes cards that provide additional mana or card advantage to help maintain momentum. With a mix of efficient creatures and burn spells, this Gruul Aggro deck aims to apply constant pressure and force the opponent to react defensively, ultimately leading to victory through relentless attacks and direct damage.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble the Omniscience Combo by utilizing cards like Roiling Dragonstorm and Temporary Lockdown to control the board and set up for a powerful combo finish. Marang River Regent and Ephara's Dispersal provide additional threats and disruption, while Stock Up and Meticulous Archive help to dig for key pieces. The deck also includes some counter magic with Spell Pierce and Confounding Riddle for protection. The mana base supports the combo strategy with a mix of lands for consistency and utility.

The focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with aggressive, low-cost creatures and efficient burn spells. By using cards like Emberheart Challenger and Burst Lightning to deal damage directly to the opponent's life total, combined with creatures like Screaming Nemesis to apply constant pressure, the deck aims to win the game before the opponent can stabilize. The inclusion of cards like Witchstalker Frenzy and Monstrous Rage further enhances the deck's ability to deal damage quickly and efficiently, making it a powerful force in the Aggro archetype.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures. It also includes cards that allow you to draw cards, gain life, and create tokens to help maintain advantage and stabilize the board. By efficiently managing resources and disrupting your opponent's game plan, you can outlast and outwit them until you are able to close out the game with your powerful finishers. The deck's mana base is carefully crafted to ensure consistent access to all the colors needed for its spells.

This Mono Black Control deck focuses on utilizing powerful creatures like Archfiend of the Dross and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes removal spells like Go for the Throat and Cut Down to deal with threats. Duress is used to strip the opponent's hand of important cards, while Unholy Annex / Ritual Chamber provides additional utility. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent with its powerful creatures and disruptive spells, ultimately taking control of the game and winning through attrition.

This Orzhov Aggro deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with a quick and aggressive strategy. It includes a mix of low-cost creatures like Nurturing Pixie and Preacher of the Schism, along with powerful finishers like Sunpearl Kirin and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Hopeless Nightmare and Temporary Lockdown to control the board and push for victory. With a good balance of creatures, removal, and disruption, this deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain the advantage throughout the game.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on playing low-cost aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter to quickly deal damage to the opponent. Cards like Monstrous Rage and Stormchaser's Talent help pump up creatures for more damage potential. Opt and Sleight of Hand provide card advantage and help dig for key cards. Burst Lightning and Into the Flood Maw offer removal options. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient creature attacks backed up by burn spells and combat tricks. The mana base of Mountains, and red/blue dual lands ensures consistent mana production for the deck's spells.

The main idea in this deck is to aggressively attack the opponent using creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Cori-Steel Cutter, and Drake Hatcher while also utilizing burn spells like Burst Lightning and Monstrous Rage to control the board. The deck also includes card draw and selection spells like Opt, Sleight of Hand, and Stock Up to maintain card advantage. With a mix of creatures, burn spells, and card draw, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly and efficiently in order to secure a victory.

The focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful instant/sorcery spells. By utilizing cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter, along with efficient spells like Burst Lightning and Opt, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. The inclusion of cards like Drake Hatcher and Slickshot Show-Off provide additional threats and ways to push damage through. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive strategy, allowing for consistent access to the necessary colors of mana.

The main focus of this UR Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures while using spells to control the board and deal direct damage. The deck includes a mix of low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter, along with burn spells like Burst Lightning and Torch the Tower to finish off opponents. The deck also features card draw spells like Opt and Sleight of Hand to maintain a consistent flow of threats and answers. With a well-balanced mix of creatures and burn spells, this deck aims to push through damage quickly and efficiently.

This deck focuses on quickly building up a board of aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter to deal damage to the opponent early on. With efficient spells like Burst Lightning and Monstrous Rage, along with card draw from Opt and Sleight of Hand, the deck aims to maintain tempo and pressure the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Drake Hatcher and Slickshot Show-Off provide additional threats and versatility. By utilizing the UR color combination, this deck can easily switch between aggression and control to keep opponents on their toes.

The Dimir Aggro deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Duress and Phantom Interference, while also taking advantage of aggressive creatures like Spyglass Siren and Floodpits Drowner to apply pressure early on. With removal spells like Go for the Throat and Cut Down, the deck aims to control the board and clear the way for its own creatures to attack. Enduring Curiosity allows for card draw to maintain momentum, while powerful finishers like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares can help secure victory in the late game.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively use creatures and removal spells to control the battlefield and quickly deal damage to the opponent. By combining powerful creatures like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse with efficient removal like Go for the Throat and Cut Down, the deck aims to maintain board control and pressure the opponent. Additionally, cards like Stock Up and Enduring Curiosity provide card advantage and additional resources to further push the aggressive strategy. The mix of creatures and spells in the deck creates a versatile and dynamic playstyle that can adapt to various matchups.

This deck focuses on flooding the board with low-cost creatures and using disruption spells to control the opponent's board. The key strategy is to maintain board presence while using removal and counterspells to efficiently deal with threats. Enduring Curiosity helps with card draw, while cards like Cut Down and Go for the Throat provide removal options. Kaito, Bane of Nightmares can be a game-changer against certain matchups. The mana base is optimized for consistency and the inclusion of Soulstone Sanctuary and Restless Reef gives the deck some resilience against aggressive decks.

The main focus of this deck is to consistently apply early pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient burn spells. By utilizing cards like Emberheart Challenger, Monastery Swiftspear, and Burst Lightning, the deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. Additionally, cards like Might of the Meek and Monstrous Rage provide ways to further boost the damage output of the creatures. The mana base is designed to support a fast and consistent start, allowing the deck to maintain its aggressive strategy throughout the game.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and board wipes. By disrupting the opponent's strategy and generating card advantage, the deck aims to maintain control of the game until it can win with powerful finishers like Marang River Regent and Roiling Dragonstorm. The mana base is designed to ensure smooth color fixing and access to all necessary resources. The deck's goal is to outlast and outmaneuver opponents by carefully managing resources and making strategic plays.

This deck focuses on quick and aggressive plays with Mono Black creatures and removal spells. Key cards like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Archfiend of the Dross provide powerful threats, while Go for the Throat and Cut Down handle opposing creatures. Duress disrupts the opponent's hand, while Unholy Annex / Ritual Chamber provide additional value. The strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a strong creature presence and efficient removal, aiming to finish the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The main focus of this Mono Black Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's resources while generating card advantage and pressure with high-value creatures. The deck utilizes a mix of removal spells, hand disruption, and powerful threats like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Archfiend of the Dross to outvalue the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Mazemind Tome and Unholy Annex / Ritual Chamber to generate card advantage and maintain board presence. The overall strategy is to outlast the opponent, grind them out with card advantage, and win the game with powerful finishers.

The deck focuses on using various control spells to stall the game and protect key combo pieces until Omniscience can be played. Once Omniscience is in play, the player can cast spells from their hand for free, enabling powerful combos like Roiling Dragonstorm to overwhelm the opponent. Marang River Regent provides additional advantage and protection, while cards like Moment of Truth and Stock Up help to dig for combo pieces. The deck aims to establish a dominant board presence and win the game quickly once the combo is set up.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. Cards like Wild Ride, Desperate Measures, and Monstrous Rage help deal damage directly to the opponent or clear the way for attacks. Leyline of Resonance and Turn Inside Out provide additional damage boosts, while Slickshot Show-Off and Callous Sell-Sword offer utility and card advantage. The deck also includes a mix of low-cost creatures like Cacophony Scamp and Manifold Mouse, along with stronger finishers like Heartfire Hero and Emberheart Challenger. The mana base ensures consistent access to both red and black mana sources for spells.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay, utilizing low-cost creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. Combining creatures like Cori-Steel Cutter and Slickshot Show-Off with spells like Burst Lightning and Monstrous Rage allows for efficient removal and direct damage. The deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent while controlling the board with cards like Turn Inside Out and Manifold Mouse. By curving out with powerful creatures like Emberheart Challenger and Callous Sell-Sword, the deck looks to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing cheap and efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter to apply early pressure on the opponent. Spells like Burst Lightning and Monstrous Rage are used to remove threats and pump up the creatures for additional damage. The deck also includes card draw and selection spells like Opt and Sleight of Hand to maintain a steady stream of threats. The mana base is set up to ensure consistent access to both red and blue mana sources. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy.

The focus of this deck is to swiftly overwhelm the opponent with a combination of low cost aggressive creatures and burn spells. By efficiently utilizing cheap spells and creatures with prowess abilities, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently, putting pressure on the opponent from the start. The deck also includes card draw spells to maintain tempo and ensure a steady stream of threats. With a mix of creatures, burn spells, and card draw, the deck aims to maintain aggression while keeping up card advantage.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter to apply pressure on the opponent. It also includes burn spells like Burst Lightning and Torch the Tower to remove opposing threats and finish off the opponent. The deck utilizes card draw spells like Opt and Sleight of Hand to maintain card advantage and consistency. By combining aggressive creatures with efficient removal and card draw, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and win the game quickly through aggressive tactics and tempo advantage.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly play low-cost creatures like Drake Hatcher and Monastery Swiftspear, and then support them with spells like Monstrous Rage and Burst Lightning to deal damage to the opponent as fast as possible. The deck also includes card draw spells like Opt and Sleight of Hand to help find the needed cards to maintain pressure on the opponent. The mana base is designed to provide a balanced mix of blue and red mana sources to support the spells in the deck.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on quick, aggressive plays using low-cost creatures like Drake Hatcher and Monastery Swiftspear to put pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes instant spells like Burst Lightning and Torch the Tower for removal, as well as cantrips like Opt and Sleight of Hand for card selection. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with early threats and efficient spells, while maintaining card advantage with Stock Up and Stormchaser's Talent. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive game plan with a mix of Islands, Mountains, and dual lands.

This deck is focused on quickly building a board presence and dealing damage to the opponent as fast as possible. By utilizing low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter, along with powerful spells like Burst Lightning and Monstrous Rage, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. By including cards like Opt and Sleight of Hand for card selection and Stock Up for card draw, the deck aims to maintain its tempo and keep up the pressure throughout the game.
